TopicTitle: PSA: rescue missions give you debris! :<

Articles.Content:
so now rescue Kerbals aren't just floating in suits (an improvement) but their pods are cluttering up my orbit with debris!

In a game where I decided "This time, no debris!!"
Just bring a Klaw and carry the pod down with you?

Just bring a Klaw and carry the pod down with you?

That's pretty high up the tech tree.

So, yeah you'll have crap to clean up. Eventually

As long as you have girders ( aka, since the start of career ) you can clean stuff out. Just make a inverted cup with them on the ship and drag the debris to a suborbital trajectory

BTW this was the standart way of "docking" before docking ports were added to the game
I don't get it. Why don't you terminate the debris?

You really didn't notice this from 1.0.0 ?

I feel this should be in GamePlay Questions, it's not really a useful PSA if it's 5 versions out of date...

I don't get it. Why don't you terminate the debris?

Or arm the rescue craft with stock missiles and attempt to scuttle the debris after rescue to prevent the capsule from falling into enemy hands creating yet more debris:D
sorry guys, my first rescue contracts since 1, I guess.
I don't even accept them. Mainly because the kerbals would long be dead before I got there, because LS.

I don't even accept them. Mainly because the kerbals would long be dead before I got there, because LS.

Which LS are you talking about?

If you're using TAC-LS: it gives you a free ride until the first time the ship goes "live" (i.e. the first time you get your currently controlled ship within 2.3 km of it). And even then, you have as long as a Kerbal EVA suit's LS will last, which is several hours.
I've played with the idea of aligning the rescue craft to blow up the debris with a engine blast... havent seen if it works tho...
